content: <@!425279588009246720> <@!425274498732916736> <@!275684146658148352> Small correction to EIP-3670: It should list 0x48 (BASEFEE, EIP-3198) as a valid opcode. The Yellow Paper hasn't been updated to London yet.

content: <@!275684146658148352> <@!425279588009246720> <@!425274498732916736> And EIP-3855 should say "base" for the gas cost of 2. "verylow" means  3 (at least in the Yellow Paper).

author: yperbasis
content: <@!425279588009246720> IMHO 2 gas for PUSH0 makes sense since it's the same for many opcodes like ADDRESS, CHAINID, POP, etc. 1 gas is used only for JUMPDEST.
